# Impact Signals ‚Äî Full Content
> Complete episode content for LLM ingestion

Website: https://impactsignals.ai
Summary version: https://impactsignals.ai/llms.txt

## Episode 7 ‚Äî 2026-02-19
### #7: Social Impact of AI ‚Äî WFP Grain ATMs, Google $75M Pledge, Latam-GPT Launch
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/7-wfp-grain-atms-google-75m-latam-gpt/

üü† Humanitarian AI üî¥ Disaster Response üü¢ Recovery üü£ Innovation Episode 7 February 19, 2026 WFP Grain ATMs for 800M, Google Pledges $75M for AI Impact, Latam-GPT Launches for 700M Speakers AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 19, 2026 üéß Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. WFP Deputy Chief: AI Must Stretch Shrinking Aid as 318M Face Hunger At the India AI Impact Summit, WFP Deputy Executive Director Carl Skau delivered a stark message: with funding down 40% and 318 million people facing acute hunger across 68 countries ‚Äî triple from five years ago ‚Äî AI is no longer optional. WFP's Chief Data Officer said AI tools could improve operational efficiency by 30-50%, optimizing delivery routes, predicting crop failures, and identifying at-risk communities. IFAD announced pilot AI apps for smallholder farmers in Nigeria and Kenya. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Straits Times, UN News 2. WFP Showcases Grain ATMs, Smart Warehouses and Route AI at India Summit Five production AI systems demonstrated at scale: Annapurti "grain ATMs" ‚Äî biometric dispensers providing 24/7 food access, scaling nationally in India and into Nepal; smart warehouses with real-time sensors tracking moisture, pests, and stock levels; route optimization serving 800+ million beneficiaries across 600,000+ shops; crisis-mapping platforms; and humanitarian communication avatars. A hackathon produced three winning solutions for last-mile nutrition gaps. Framework tags: Response, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: UN News, Business Standard 3. Google Announces $75M+ in AI for Social Good at India Summit Google's largest-ever social impact commitment: $30M AI for Government Innovation Challenge (deadline April 3), $30M AI for Science Impact Challenge (deadline April 17), a new Climate Technology Center with India's Principal Scientific Adviser, and DeepMind National Partnerships for frontier AI in agriculture, education, and climate resilience. Plus $15B in India AI infrastructure investment. Framework tags: Resilience, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Google Blog, Times of India 4. CERF Climate Action Fund Rebuilds Resilient Homes in Cameroon CERF's new Climate Action Account funds climate-resilient shelter construction in Cameroon's Far North, where 2024 floods affected 356,730 people. Displaced families build permanent climate-adapted homes themselves. In Minawao refugee camp (80,000+ residents), CERF-funded boreholes enable climate-adaptive farming ‚Äî refugees harvested 50+ tons of sorghum and millet and are expanding into vegetables. Framework tags: Recovery, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ReliefWeb/UNHCR 5. Indonesia Allocates $128M for Post-Disaster Sumatra Recovery Parliament allocated $128M after floods and landslides wiped 29 villages off the map. Full relocation required. Education Ministry seeking $142M for school reconstruction. The disaster is forcing a deforestation accountability reckoning ‚Äî permits revoked, lawsuits filed, state takeovers threatened against companies whose environmental destruction worsened the flooding. Framework tags: Recovery, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ANTARA News, Jakarta Post 6. Latam-GPT: First Open-Source LLM for Latin America Chile's CENIA released a 70B-parameter model trained on 230+ billion words of Spanish and Portuguese, built by 30+ universities across 8 countries for $550K. Addresses a critical NLP gap ‚Äî Spanish is ~4% and Portuguese ~2% of typical LLM training data. Indigenous language support planned. Enables humanitarian NLP: crisis message classification, needs assessment chatbots, and communication tools that work for affected populations. Framework tags: Preparedness, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Euronews, AI Business 7. Cyclone Gezani: Copernicus EMSR Activated for Madagascar One of the most intense landfalls in Madagascar's satellite era: 250 km/h winds, 25,000 homes destroyed, 27,000 flooded, 63+ dead. EU Copernicus activated for satellite damage mapping. Compound disaster in Mozambique where soils were already saturated from prior flooding. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ReliefWeb/OCHA, BBC 8. Sudan Drone Strikes Kill 57 Including 15 Children 57 killed in Kordofan drone strikes in two days. UNICEF confirmed 15 children died and 10 wounded in displacement camp attack. Sudan's civil war has displaced 11 million and triggered famine. The targeting of camps with drones underscores the urgent need for civilian protection technology including AI-based early warning in conflict zones. Framework tags: Response, Relief &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: UN News, Sudan Tribune üìÖ Upcoming Events Google.org AI for Government Innovation Challenge Deadline: April 3, 2026 Location: Global (virtual) Why it matters: $30M for nonprofits and social enterprises building AI-powered public service solutions. Link: Apply Google.org AI for Science Impact Challenge Deadline: April 17, 2026 Location: Global Why it matters: $30M for researchers using AI for climate, health, and sustainability breakthroughs. Devoteam Global AI Hackathon Dates: March 13‚Äì15, 2026 Location: Remote (48 hours) Why it matters: Intensive build on high-impact client challenges. AAAI Spring Symposium: AI+HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Burlingame, CA Why it matters: AI researchers meet humanitarian/disaster relief practitioners. Link: AAAI üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) Cyclone Gezani (Madagascar/Mozambique): Damage assessment underway. 25,000+ homes destroyed, 27,000+ flooded, 63+ dead. Copernicus EMSR satellite mapping activated. Compound flooding in Mozambique. Sumatra Floods (Indonesia): Recovery phase. 29 villages lost, $128M allocated. 53 affected regencies under data validation. Sudan Conflict: 57 killed in drone strikes. 11M displaced. Famine conditions. Humanitarian access critically restricted. Kenya Drought: 3.3M facing acute hunger across ASAL counties. WFP predictive analytics deployed. Mozambique Floods: OCHA Flash Update #7. Saturated soils compounded by Cyclone Gezani. Sources: UN News, ReliefWeb, Straits Times, Google Blog, ANTARA News, Euronews, BBC, Sudan Tribune, Business Standard, Jakarta Post, AI Business, GDACS, OCHA


---

## Episode 6 ‚Äî 2026-02-18
### #6: AI for Social Impact ‚Äî WFP Food Distribution AI, Google $60M Impact Challenge, NASA Cyclone Mapping
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/6-wfp-ai-food-google-60m-cyclone-gezani/

üü† Humanitarian AI üî¥ Disaster Response üîµ Policy &amp; Governance üü£ Innovation Episode 6 February 18, 2026 WFP AI Food Distribution at Scale, Google Commits $60M, NASA Satellite AI for Cyclone Gezani AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 18, 2026 üéß Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. WFP &amp; India Showcase AI-Powered Food Distribution at Scale The World Food Programme and India's Department of Food &amp; Public Distribution jointly unveiled AI-driven innovations transforming India's Public Distribution System at the India AI Impact Summit 2026. Three operational tools: Grain ATMs delivering precise food entitlements via fully digital systems, Smart Warehouse Solutions using sensor-based AI to prevent food losses, and Route Optimization Functions cutting costs and carbon emissions. WFP needs $13B to assist 110M people in 2026 but faces funding shortfalls forcing ration reductions. WFP's Magan Naidoo: AI is "an accelerator, not a human replacement." Framework tags: Relief, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ReliefWeb, Business Standard, ChiniMandi 2. Google Commits $60M to AI for Government &amp; Science Impact Challenges Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced $30M for a Global AI for Government Innovation Impact Challenge and $30M for an AI for Science Impact Challenge. Google DeepMind established a national partnership with India for frontier AI in science and education. A new Center for Climate Technology launched in India. Plus a $15B infrastructure investment. Data shows 74% of public servants globally use AI but only 18% believe their governments deploy it effectively ‚Äî the gap these challenges aim to close. Framework tags: Resilience, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Google Blog, DeepMind Blog, News9 3. NASA Deploys Satellite AI for Cyclone Gezani Damage Assessment NASA's Earth Observatory used MODIS, Landsat 8 OLI, and IMERG satellite data to map devastation from Cyclone Gezani in Madagascar. Category 3 cyclone with 200 km/h winds killed at least 63 people, injured 804, displaced 16,000+, and destroyed 25,000 homes. Rain rates hit 4 cm/hour over Toamasina. This was Madagascar's second cyclone in 11 days. Copernicus EMSR activated rapid mapping; SADC deployed a geospatial team alongside MapAction and WFP. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: NASA Earth Observatory, Reuters, AllAfrica/SADC 4. India AI Summit Sets Guinness Record: 250,946 Responsible AI Pledges The India AI Impact Summit ‚Äî first global AI summit in the Global South ‚Äî set a Guinness World Record with 250,946 valid pledges for AI responsibility in 24 hours, organized by IndiaAI Mission and Intel India. 110+ countries, 30+ international organizations, ~20 heads of state. UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk: "AI has incredible force for good, but when you exercise power, you also need guardrails and constraints." Framework tags: Resilience, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Economic Times, LiveMint 5. ICRC Appeals for 1.8 Billion Swiss Francs for 2026 Operations The International Committee of the Red Cross launched its ~$2B USD appeal for 2026 across active conflict zones. Priority: 89,000+ missing persons in Ukraine, detention visits, civilian protection. The ICRC's digital transformation includes AI-assisted case management for missing persons and predictive modeling for anticipatory action ‚Äî essential when processing tens of thousands of cases. Framework tags: Relief, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ICRC, ReliefWeb 6. Pakistan Food Insecurity Report Meets $1B AI Commitment The IPC published its Acute Food Insecurity Analysis for Pakistan (Dec 2025 ‚Äì Sep 2026) one week after Pakistan committed $1B to AI by 2030 at Indus AI Week. The convergence of food insecurity data and national AI investment signals an opportunity for AI-driven early warning systems and precision agriculture in one of the most climate-vulnerable nations. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ReliefWeb/IPC, Manila Times 7. Multi-Crisis Watch: Indonesia Floods, Sudan Refugees, Burkina Faso ECHO reports severe floods in Indonesia (Central Java: 2,400+ displaced, La Ni√±a). UNHCR Flash Update #45 on Sudan refugee influx into Chad. Sri Lanka multi-hazard situation report. Burkina Faso appeals for 2.7M vulnerable people. 21 forest fire alerts across Africa, SE Asia, and the Americas. Concurrent crises underscore the need for AI-powered multi-hazard early warning and resource allocation. Framework tags: Response, Relief, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: EU/ECHO, UNHCR, BNPB, GDACS üìÖ Upcoming Events India AI Impact Summit 2026 (ONGOING) Dates: February 16‚Äì20, 2026 Location: Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, India Why it matters: First global AI summit in the Global South. 110+ countries, 20 heads of state. Day 3 features climate tech sessions. IEEE CAI 2026 Dates: May 8‚Äì10, 2026 (early bird deadline March 1) Location: Granada, Spain Why it matters: Major AI conference with social implications tracks. AAAI Spring Symposium: AI + HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Burlingame, CA Why it matters: Premier AI + humanitarian assistance gathering. Keynote by Milind Tambe. Link: aaai.org üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) Madagascar/Mozambique: Cyclone Gezani ‚Äî 63+ dead, 16,000+ displaced, 25,000 homes destroyed. NASA MODIS/Landsat active. Copernicus EMSR activated. SADC geospatial team deployed Feb 16‚Äì28. Indonesia (Central Java): Severe floods and landslides ‚Äî 2,400+ displaced. La Ni√±a conditions through early 2026. Sudan ‚Üí Chad: Continued refugee influx. UNHCR Flash Update #45. Syria: IFRC DREF operation active for flooding. Sri Lanka: Multi-hazard situation report issued February 18. Pakistan: IPC acute food insecurity analysis published. Burkina Faso: 2.7 million people need humanitarian assistance in 2026. üí° Signal Watch NVIDIA + GiveDirectly: Exploring AI for faster, pre-crisis cash transfers at scale. Africa CDC + FHI 360: MoU signed for health security and Africa's health sovereignty. Malawi: Completed vaccination of 1.3 million children in polio outbreak response. Google.org: Now accepting applications for $60M in AI for Government + Science challenges. Sources: ReliefWeb, OCHA, GDACS, NASA Earth Observatory, Google Blog, DeepMind Blog, Business Standard, Economic Times, LiveMint, Reuters, AllAfrica/SADC, ICRC, IPC, EU/ECHO, UNHCR, BNPB

## Episode 5 ‚Äî 2026-02-17
### #5: Artificial Intelligence Impact ‚Äî India Healthcare AI, UNICEF Child Safety, Emergency Drones
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/5-india-healthcare-ai-unicef-child-safety/

üîµ Policy &amp; Governance üü† Humanitarian AI üî¥ Disaster Response üü£ Innovation Episode 5 February 17, 2026 India Healthcare AI Strategy, UNICEF Child Safety Rules, Emergency Drones Go Live AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 17, 2026 üéß Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. India Launches SAHI &amp; BODH ‚Äî First National AI Healthcare Strategy in South-East Asia India's Health Minister JP Nadda launched SAHI (Strategy for Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare for India) and BODH (Benchmarking Open Data Platform for Health AI) at the India AI Impact Summit on February 17. WHO's Catharina Boehme called India "the first country in South-East Asia to adopt a comprehensive national AI strategy for health." AI is already integrated into India's public health system for TB risk prediction, diabetic retinopathy screening, and telemedicine. BODH ensures AI tools used by frontline health workers are safe, effective, and benchmarked against real-world outcomes. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Tribune India, Business Standard, NDTV, The Hindu 2. India AI Impact Summit ‚Äî Largest Global AI Governance Gathering Yet The India AI Impact Summit 2026 opened February 16 at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi ‚Äî the first global AI summit hosted in the Global South. PM Modi, Macron, Lula, UN Secretary-General Guterres, and major tech CEOs attending the 5-day event. Released the "AI Compendium" playbook and "Seven Chakras" framework for international AI cooperation. 250,000+ visitors, 600+ AI startups, $68B in AI investment commitments through 2030. Framework tags: Resilience, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Al Jazeera, NDTV, BBC, CNBC, France 24 3. UNDRR Calls for Legal Framework for AI in Disaster Management At the India AI Summit, UNDRR's Sujit Mohanty declared that AI in disaster management urgently needs legal and policy frameworks. Ground-level officials like district magistrates cannot rely on AI-driven tools without legal backing for their decisions. India's innovative use of AI in disaster prediction offers a blueprint that could help reduce the $200 billion in global annual disaster losses. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Business Standard, Devdiscourse, Hindustan Times 4. UNICEF Releases "Guidance on AI and Children 3.0" ‚Äî Mandates Child Rights Impact Assessments UNICEF released its most actionable policy guidance yet, calling on governments to mandate Child Rights Impact Assessments (CRIA) for any AI system deployed in public services. 10 core requirements including "Safety by Design," strict prohibitions on biometric data harvesting from children in refugee settings, and algorithmic audits for fairness across linguistic groups. UNICEF India Representative Cynthia McCaffrey: AI must be "safe by default." Framework tags: Recovery, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: UNICEF, Deccan Herald, The Hindu 5. Salesforce/Good360 AI Agent Transforms Disaster Relief Matching Good360 used Agentforce AI agents during the 2025 LA wildfires. Reduced product-to-nonprofit matching from 30 to 10 minutes and anticipated needs the human team hadn't ‚Äî locating tents and proactively suggesting workboots. The UN's "Early Warnings for All" initiative is using AI-powered NLP to translate disaster alerts into multiple languages. Framework tags: Response, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Salesforce Blog 6. IRC Airbel Impact Lab: AI-Powered ReachMap Finds 10-20% More Unvaccinated Children Amid 83% USAID grant cancellations, the IRC's Airbel Impact Lab shows how AI can stretch shrinking budgets. ReachMap combines satellite imagery and AI route planning to reach 10-20% more zero-dose children while cutting costs 15-25% per child. "Follow the Forecast" uses predictive data for anticipatory cash transfers before disasters hit. Framework tags: Relief, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: fundsforNGOs News, IRC 7. Everdrone Deploys Autonomous Emergency Drones in Stockholm Multi-year agreement with Region Stockholm to deploy autonomous drones delivering defibrillators for cardiac arrest emergencies. Drones launch simultaneously with ambulances upon 112 calls, using computer vision for obstacle avoidance and BVLOS navigation. Live video to dispatchers for scene assessment. Shift from pilot to fully integrated municipal emergency response. Framework tags: Response, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Unmanned Systems Technology, Everdrone 8. University of Twente: Drones Cut Humanitarian Delivery Delays by 85% AI-optimized drone logistics tested across six historical disasters (Haiti earthquake, Indonesia tsunami, Hurricane Dorian). Transport costs reduced 7-16%, reachable locations increased 11-56%, delivery delays decreased up to 85%. Most effective for the hardest-to-reach 10-20% of locations. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: University of Twente üìÖ Upcoming Events India AI Impact Summit 2026 Dates: February 16‚Äì20, 2026 Location: New Delhi, India Why it matters: Largest global AI governance gathering. Dedicated tracks on AI for Social Good, Healthcare, Disaster Resilience. Currently underway. NVIDIA GTC 2026 Dates: March 16‚Äì19, 2026 Location: San Jose, CA + Virtual Why it matters: Major tracks on climate modeling (Earth-2 digital twins), healthcare AI, and public sector deployment. AAAI Spring Symposium: AI + HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Burlingame, CA Why it matters: Premier academic venue bridging AI researchers and disaster relief practitioners. Link: hadr.ai Responsible AI Forum 2026 Dates: May 19‚Äì20, 2026 Location: Munich, Germany Why it matters: Research, policy, and practice on ethical AI deployment. Link: responsibleaiforum.com üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) M6.0 earthquake ‚Äî Russia: February 16, depth 43km, ~5,000 exposed at MMI IV intensity. M5.7 earthquake ‚Äî Solomon Islands: February 16. Pacific ring of fire activity. Flood alerts: Active across United States, Peru, Turkey, Afghanistan, Ukraine, Montenegro. Sudan: War approaching fourth year. Humanitarian agencies appeal for refugee support. Yemen: Rapid displacement tracking active (Feb 8-14). üí° Signal Watch USAID Funding Crisis: 83% of grants cancelled. UK and Germany following with cuts. IRC reports 6M+ clients with service interruptions, 2M lost services entirely. Google Flood Hub Expansion: Now covering 80+ countries, 460M+ people with 7-day forecasts. Triggering anticipatory cash transfers in Bangladesh and Nigeria. Ethical Counter-Narrative: New academic research on dual-use risks of satellite/CV technologies used for humanitarian purposes in conflict zones. Sources: Al Jazeera, BBC, CNBC, NDTV, The Hindu, Tribune India, Business Standard, Devdiscourse, Hindustan Times, UNICEF, Deccan Herald, Salesforce, IRC, fundsforNGOs, University of Twente, Unmanned Systems Technology, Everdrone, GDACS, OCHA, ReliefWeb

## Episode 4 ‚Äî 2026-02-16
### #4: AI for Social Good ‚Äî India Summit, Legal Gaps in Disaster AI, 1.1B Hunger Crisis
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/4-india-summit-legal-gaps-hunger-crisis/

üîµ Policy &amp; Governance üü† Humanitarian AI üî¥ Disaster Response üü£ Innovation Episode 4 February 16, 2026 India AI Summit Launches, UNDRR Warns Legal Gaps Block AI Disaster Response, AI Predicts 1.1 Billion Face Hunger AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 16, 2026 üéß Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. India AI Impact Summit Opens ‚Äî 250,000 Expected at First Global South AI Summit PM Modi inaugurated the five-day India AI Impact Summit at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi ‚Äî the largest AI gathering ever hosted in the developing world. With 20 national leaders, 45 ministerial delegations, and CEOs from Google, NVIDIA, Microsoft, and OpenAI, the summit features seven thematic "Chakras" including Safe &amp; Trusted AI, AI for Health, and Inclusion for Social Empowerment. India is positioning its "Digital Public Infrastructure" (DPI) approach as an alternative ‚Äî AI as a public utility, not a proprietary platform. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Al Jazeera, CNBC, NDTV 2. UNDRR: "Glorious AI Apps Will Sit as Dashboards" Without Legal Framework UNDRR's Sujit Mohanty told the India AI Summit that AI disaster apps are useless without enabling legal frameworks. District magistrates ‚Äî the officials who decide when and whom to evacuate ‚Äî cannot rely on AI predictions without legal accountability. Global disaster losses: ~$200 billion annually. He called for India's "frugal AI" approach to be exported to less-resourced nations, building regulatory scaffolding alongside technology. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Business Standard 3. AI Model: Climate Change Could Push 1.1 Billion Into Hunger by 2100 Published in Nature Scientific Reports, an AI model calibrated on FEWS NET data predicts climate change alone could drive 1.1 billion people ‚Äî including 600+ million children ‚Äî into severe food crises. Africa: 170 million face starvation in 2099 alone. The model uses only temperature and precipitation inputs, making it deployable in data-scarce humanitarian regions where traditional models can't reach. Framework tags: Resilience, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Phys.org, Nature Scientific Reports 4. India Launches SAHI &amp; BODH ‚Äî National AI Healthcare Frameworks Health Minister Nadda announced SAHI (Strategy for AI in Healthcare for India) and BODH (Benchmarking Open Data Platform for Health AI) at the summit. BODH creates open benchmarking datasets for transparent comparison of health AI models ‚Äî a critical gap blocking adoption in low-resource settings. Directly replicable for disaster health response. Framework tags: Recovery, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: The Hindu, Moneycontrol 5. Nonprofit AI Report: 92% Adopt AI, Only 7% See Real Impact A study of 346 nonprofits reveals a stark "adoption-impact gap." 81% use AI individually without shared workflows. 47% have no AI governance policy. Organizations seeing real impact embed AI into cross-functional workflows ‚Äî not individual heroics. For humanitarian organizations: adoption without workflow redesign is a trap. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: PRNewswire 6. Kerala Outlines AI Roadmap for Disaster Preparedness At Kerala's "Vision 2031" conference: AI-driven heat stress predictions at granular administrative levels, mobile-first emergency alerts building on 2018 flood lessons, and AI for human-animal conflict management. The mobile-first approach is directly transferable to other climate-vulnerable regions. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: The Hindu 7. China Classifies AI Security Incidents as National Disaster Category First nation to institutionalize AI containment within civil defense ‚Äî "loss of human control" and "unforeseen incidents" now classified alongside earthquakes in China's National Emergency Response Plan. Sets a precedent for integrating AI risk into existing disaster management infrastructure globally. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ASPI Strategist 8. UN Women + Bioniks: AI Prosthetics for Rural Women in Pakistan Continued deployment of AI-powered, 3D-modeled prosthetic limbs for women in Sindh province who lost limbs to fodder cutter accidents. Customized at dramatically lower costs than imports. "Homegrown AI" from the Global South with direct conflict-zone applicability. Framework tags: Recovery, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: UN.org, Channel Africa üìÖ Upcoming Events (Next 30 Days) India AI Impact Summit 2026 Dates: February 16‚Äì20, 2026 Location: Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, India Organizer: Government of India (MeitY) Why it matters: Ongoing ‚Äî first Global South AI summit. Seven thematic tracks, UN side events, 250K+ attendees. Link: impact.indiaai.gov.in ITU "AI for Good" Webinar: The Why of AI Dates: February 18, 2026 Location: Virtual Organizer: ITU Why it matters: Causal inference in observational data ‚Äî critical for bias reduction in humanitarian datasets. Link: aiforgood.itu.int Stanford HAI: Nurturing Africa's AI Leaders Dates: February 25, 2026 Location: Hybrid (Stanford + Virtual) Why it matters: African Olympiad Academy founders on building AI talent pipelines for Africa. Link: hai.stanford.edu Code4Sudan PyTorch Hackathon Dates: Through February 28, 2026 Location: Virtual Why it matters: Grassroots crisis informatics hackathon mobilizing the Sudanese diaspora. Link: code4sudan.com AAAI Spring Symposium: AI+HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Burlingame, CA Why it matters: Bridging AI researchers and HADR practitioners. Keynote: Milind Tambe. Link: aaai.org üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) Madagascar ‚Äî Tropical Cyclone Gezani: Landfall near Toamasina with 250 km/h gusts. Second cyclone in three weeks. 59+ dead, 16,000+ displaced, 400,000 in acute need. Damage: $142M. International relief from France, US, EU, UN. East Africa (Somalia, Ethiopia, Kenya): Severe drought. 4.6M affected, 135K+ displaced in Somalia. Rising livestock mortality, record cereal prices, acute child malnutrition. Sudan: Ongoing conflict. Human Appeal reached 862,000+ people. Humanitarian access severely constrained. South Sudan (Jonglei): Conflict; 280,000 displaced (53% children). Haiti: Displacement from Port-au-Prince attacks. CCCM cluster active. Sources: Al Jazeera, CNBC, NDTV, Business Standard, Nature Scientific Reports, Phys.org, The Hindu, Moneycontrol, PRNewswire, ASPI Strategist, UN.org, Channel Africa, ReliefWeb, GDACS, OCHA


---

## Episode 3 ‚Äî 2026-02-15
### #3: AI and Humanitarian Aid ‚Äî India AI Summit, AI Prosthetics in Pakistan, UN Global AI Fund
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/3-india-ai-summit-prosthetics-global-ai-fund/

üîµ Policy &amp; Governance üü† Humanitarian AI üî¥ Disaster Response üü£ Innovation Episode 3 February 15, 2026 India AI Summit Opens Tomorrow, AI Prosthetics Transform Lives in Pakistan, UN Proposes Global AI Fund AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 15, 2026 üéß Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. India AI Impact Summit Opens Tomorrow ‚Äî First Global AI Summit in the Global South The India AI Impact Summit 2026 kicks off February 16‚Äì20 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi ‚Äî the first major global AI summit ever hosted in the Global South. Over 700 sessions are planned. Confirmed attendees include UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei, and Bill Gates. Over 4,650 global applications were received for AI challenges focused on healthcare, climate, and inclusive growth. The summit's theme ‚Äî "People, Planet, and Progress" ‚Äî explicitly prioritizes development-focused AI over the existential-risk framing of prior Western summits. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Times of India, IndiaAI Mission 2. AI-Powered Prosthetics Transform Lives of Injured Women in Pakistan Karachi-based Bioniks Technologies partnered with UN Women to design and deliver AI-powered prosthetic limbs for women in Pakistan's Sindh province who lost hands or arms to fodder-cutting machines. Using 3D modeling, digital scanning, and AI, they created lightweight bionic arms enabling women to return to hand embroidery ‚Äî their primary income source. The initiative also provided training, psychological support, and community safety awareness. Bioniks is now expanding across Pakistan and into Gulf markets. Framework tags: Recovery, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: UN News 3. UN Secretary-General Proposes Global Fund on AI at African Union Summit At the 39th AU Summit in Addis Ababa on February 14, Secretary-General Guterres formally proposed a Global Fund on AI to build capacity in developing nations ‚Äî skills, data infrastructure, and compute power. He framed the "AI divide" as the new inequality frontier, warning that nations missing AI adoption risk falling 50 years behind. The proposal directly targets African data sovereignty and compute ownership rather than dependence on Western tech infrastructure. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Gemini Deep Research 4. AXA and Planet Labs Partner for AI-Powered Real-Time Disaster Monitoring Announced February 12, this strategic partnership integrates Planet Labs' near-daily global satellite imagery into AXA's AI-powered risk management platform. The system monitors, predicts, and responds to natural disasters ‚Äî floods, wildfires, hurricanes ‚Äî in near-real-time. While initially insurance-focused, the technology has direct humanitarian applications for disaster preparedness and response coordination. Framework tags: Response, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: BusinessWire 5. SPARC AI Releases GPS-Denied Drone Navigation for Search &amp; Rescue SPARC AI released an upgraded "Overwatch" system ‚Äî a software-only update enabling search and rescue drones to operate in GPS-jammed or signal-denied environments. Using machine learning and visual cues to correct navigation drift, it removes the need for expensive hardware upgrades. Critical for humanitarian SAR in conflict zones where GPS jamming is common. The "zero-signature" capability also protects humanitarian workers. Framework tags: Response, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Gemini Deep Research 6. New 60-Day Flood Forecasting Framework Extends Early Warning Horizon Published this week in EGUsphere, researchers developed a framework combining convolutional neural networks for bias correction of precipitation forecasts with process-based hydrological modeling. The result: a 60-day streamflow forecasting capability with high volumetric accuracy. This dramatically extends early warning from days to months, providing critical decision support for flood-prone regions. Framework tags: Resilience, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Copernicus/EGU 7. East Africa Drought Crisis: 4.6 Million Affected, AI Early Warning Systems Tested The EU Joint Research Centre reports severe drought across Somalia, southeastern Ethiopia, and eastern Kenya since September 2025. As of January 2026, 4.6 million people are affected, with 135,000+ displaced in Somalia alone. Rising livestock mortality, record-high cereal prices, and increasing acute child malnutrition mark the crisis. Copernicus EMS and FEWS NET satellite-AI systems are actively tracking conditions. Framework tags: Response, Relief &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: EU JRC Global Drought Observatory 8. OpenStreetMap Releases Photon 1.0.0 ‚Äî Better Offline Mapping for Disaster Zones The OSM community released Photon 1.0.0, a major update to the open-source geocoder used by humanitarian mappers worldwide. The migration to OpenSearch with streamlined database structures significantly reduces hardware requirements ‚Äî enabling field teams to run high-performance offline search tools on laptops without internet. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: OpenStreetMap Community üìÖ Upcoming Events (Next 30 Days) India AI Impact Summit 2026 Dates: February 16‚Äì20, 2026 Location: Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, India Organizer: Government of India (MeitY), IndiaAI Mission Why it matters: First global AI summit in the Global South. UN side events, 37+ CEOs. Sets agenda for non-Western AI governance. Link: impact.indiaai.gov.in Sankalp Africa Summit 2026 Dates: February 25‚Äì26, 2026 Location: Nairobi, Kenya Organizer: Intellecap Why it matters: Premier AI + development finance event in Africa. "South-South Rising" theme. Link: sankalpforum.com AAAI Spring Symposium: AI + HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Burlingame, CA Organizer: AAAI / Howard University RITA Why it matters: Premier venue bridging AI researchers and humanitarian/disaster relief practitioners. Link: aaai.org AI &amp; Data Science for Good Hackathon Dates: March 14, 2026 Location: University of Waterloo, Ontario, Canada Why it matters: Building oral-first language tools for Rohingya refugees and low-literacy newcomers. ITU AI for Good Impact Awards Deadline: March 15, 2026 Why it matters: UN awards for AI solutions advancing SDGs. Open to startups and social enterprises. Link: aiforgood.itu.int üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) Forest fires ‚Äî Myanmar (2): Active fire notifications, February 15. Forest fires ‚Äî Cambodia (2): Active fire notifications, February 15. Forest fires ‚Äî Ethiopia (2): Active fire notifications, February 15. Forest fires ‚Äî Senegal, Guinea, CAR, Ethiopia/Sudan border: Ongoing monitoring. East Africa drought: Somalia, southeastern Ethiopia, eastern Kenya ‚Äî 4.6 million affected, 135,000+ displaced. Rising livestock mortality and child malnutrition. Sources: Times of India, UN News, Gemini Deep Research, BusinessWire, Copernicus/EGU, EU JRC, OpenStreetMap, GDACS, OCHA, FEWS NET


---

## Episode 2 ‚Äî 2026-02-14
### #2: Social Impact of AI ‚Äî AI Drones in War, Wildfire Early Action Protocol
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/2-ai-drones-civilians-wildfire-early-action/

üî¥ Disaster Response üü¢ Climate Resilience üü£ Innovation üü† Humanitarian AI Episode 2 February 14, 2026 AI Drones Turning Wars on Civilians, World's First Wildfire Early Action Protocol, Google Expands Flood Forecasting Across Africa AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 14, 2026 üéß 6:22 Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts YouTube Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. ICRC Chief Warns AI &amp; Drones Turning Wars Into Wars on Civilians ICRC President Mirjana Spoljaric told the Munich Security Conference that conflicts have doubled in 15 years and quadrupled in 30, with AI and drone technology "amplifying the negative impacts on civilians." She stated: "There's never a moment where drones fight against drones. Drones fight against the military and increasingly against civilians." She called on world leaders to adopt a protective interpretation of international humanitarian law rather than a permissive one. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Digital Journal, RTL 2. IFRC Activates World's First Wildfire Early Action Protocol in Chile The IFRC operationalized its "Simplified Early Action Protocol" for wildfires in Chile ‚Äî a global first. Predictive meteorological models tracking Puelche winds triggered the automatic release of 95,000 CHF to help 2,000 people before fires reached peak intensity. An additional 500,000 CHF from the DREF supported evacuation of 50,000 people. This is forecast-based financing in action: algorithms release money before the disaster, not after. Framework tags: Response, Relief, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: IFRC, FundsforNGOs 3. Google Expands AI Flood Forecasting Across Africa, Partners with AU Google expanded its AI-powered Flood Hub to new regions in Nigeria and Ethiopia, partnering with GiveDirectly and the African Union Commission. In Nigeria, Google's forecasts enabled GiveDirectly to deliver pre-disaster cash transfers before floodwaters rose. Google also highlighted FireSat, its satellite constellation using AI to detect wildfires as small as 5√ó5 meters with a 20-minute revisit rate. Framework tags: Resilience, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Google Blog, Salesforce/GiveDirectly case study 4. WHO Launches AI-Powered Emergency Response Toolkit (AIM) The WHO Regional Office for the Eastern Mediterranean launched the All-Hazard Information Management (AIM) Toolkit, a generative AI system that compresses emergency response document production from weeks to minutes. The chronic administrative bottleneck in humanitarian response ‚Äî writing sitreps, needs assessments, and appeals ‚Äî now has an AI solution in production at WHO. Framework tags: Response, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: WHO 5. Caltech Unveils X1: Multi-Modal Search-and-Rescue Robot Researchers from Caltech, Northeastern University, and TII unveiled the X1 ‚Äî a hybrid humanoid-drone SAR robot that autonomously switches between walking, flying, and driving based on terrain. Using sensor fusion (lidar + cameras), it decides its locomotion mode without human input. Separately, Sparc AI released Overwatch for GPS-denied drone navigation. Framework tags: Response, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Futura Sciences, Sparc AI 6. University of Twente: AI + Drone Simulation Tested on Six Historical Disasters A new study developed an AI-powered simulation model for drone-integrated humanitarian logistics, tested against six historical disasters. Smart algorithms determine which vehicle (truck, helicopter, drone) should serve which location, optimizing for cost, speed, risk, and reduction of human suffering. Framework tags: Relief, Recovery, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: University of Twente 7. Salesforce Agentforce Powers Good360's Disaster Relief Matching Good360 used an AI agent during the LA wildfires that matched donated products to nonprofit needs, reducing matching time from 30 min to 10 min. The agent proactively suggested items the team hadn't considered (e.g., workboots for first responders). Operational AI in real disaster response. Framework tags: Relief, Recovery, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Salesforce Blog 8. AI Heatwave Early Warning for Gulf Region ‚Äî Khalifa University Study A Khalifa University study analyzed the 2024 Makkah heatwave (51.8¬∞C, 1,300+ Hajj pilgrim deaths) and found AI-based forecasting can predict extreme heat events days in advance. Heatwaves in the Middle East are now 2√ó more frequent. Even 48 hours of warning at mass gatherings could save hundreds of lives. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: The National üìÖ Upcoming Events (Next 30 Days) India AI Impact Summit 2026 Dates: February 16‚Äì20, 2026 Location: Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi Organizer: Government of India Why it matters: First global AI summit in the Global South. 100+ countries, 700+ sessions on AI safety, governance, and social good. Link: impact.indiaai.gov.in IBM Impact Accelerator 2026 Deadline: March 25, 2026 Location: Virtual (Global) Organizer: IBM Why it matters: Pro bono AI + cloud support for 5 selected nonprofits. Access to watsonx, Granite AI models, IBM Cloud, and Red Hat. Link: ibmimpact.versaic.com AAAI Spring Symposium: AI + HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Burlingame, CA Organizer: AAAI / Howard University RITA Why it matters: Bridging AI researchers and HADR practitioners. Keynote by Milind Tambe. Link: aaai.org üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) Vanuatu: M6.4 earthquake, Feb 14, 02:27 UTC. GDACS automated alerting; no tsunami threat. Colombia: Flooding + double-impact; HNRP 2026 launched Feb 13. South Sudan (Jonglei): Conflict; 280,000 displaced (53% children). UNICEF displacement tracking needed. Syria: Ongoing humanitarian response, Aleppo &amp; NE. Haiti: Displacement from attacks in Port-au-Prince. CCCM cluster active. Sources: Digital Journal, RTL, IFRC, FundsforNGOs, Google Blog, Salesforce, WHO, Futura Sciences, Sparc AI, University of Twente, The National, GDACS, OCHA, ReliefWeb

## Episode 1 ‚Äî 2026-02-14
### #1: AI for Social Impact ‚Äî UN AI Panel, India Summit, and Why Aid Is Collapsing
URL: https://impactsignals.ai/episodes/1-un-ai-panel-india-summit-aid-collapsing/

üîµ Policy &amp; Governance üü† Humanitarian AI üü¢ Climate Resilience üü£ Innovation Episode 1 February 13, 2026 The UN's New AI Panel, India's AI Summit, and Why Aid Is Collapsing AI for Impact Daily Briefing ‚Äî February 13, 2026 üéß 4:03 Listen on: Spotify Apple Podcasts YouTube Substack RSS üî• Top Stories 1. UN General Assembly Approves 40-Member AI Scientific Panel Over US Objections The UN General Assembly voted 117-2 Thursday to establish the first-ever Independent International Scientific Panel on AI. The US and Paraguay were the only "no" votes. Secretary-General Guterres called it "a foundational step toward global scientific understanding of AI." The 40 members ‚Äî selected from 2,600 candidates ‚Äî will serve three-year terms starting Feb 12, 2026, issuing annual reports on AI's opportunities, risks, and impacts including humanitarian applications. Notably, the panel includes Nobel Peace laureate Maria Ressa and experts from IIT Madras, University of Minnesota, and Shanghai Jiao Tong University. The US called it "significant overreach" and warned it would "not cede authority over AI to international bodies." Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: AP via Yahoo News, China Daily, US News 2. India AI Impact Summit: First Global South AI Summit Opens Feb 16-20 with Disaster Resilience Track New Delhi hosts the AI Impact Summit starting Monday ‚Äî the largest global AI summit ever held in the Global South. PM Modi and French President Macron will inaugurate on Feb 19. The UN will convene 30+ side events covering disaster risk reduction, health systems, agriculture, food security, and children's safety. Kamal Kishore, the Secretary-General's Special Representative for Disaster Risk Reduction, will participate. India will showcase AIKosh ‚Äî a UPI-like public AI platform hosting 5,500+ datasets and 251 AI models across 20 sectors including agriculture, health, and climate. Seven focus areas include "Resilience, Innovation and Efficiency" ‚Äî exploring AI for disaster response and infrastructure. Attendees include Sam Altman, Sundar Pichai, Bill Gates, and heads of UNDP, UNICEF, and UNESCO. Registration is free. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Tribune India, Times of India, NDTV, Business Outreach 3. Tata AI Sakhi: Empowering Rural Women Through Hands-On AI at India Summit Tata Group is launching the "AI Sakhi Immersion Program" at the India AI Impact Summit ‚Äî a social-impact initiative designed to empower rural women through hands-on AI learning and real-world skill building. Targeting women entrepreneurs, artisans, and community leaders, the program helps participants explore how AI can improve productivity and unlock new opportunities in everyday life and business. Session on "Social Empowerment via AI Accessibility" scheduled Feb 17 at Bharat Mandapam. Framework tags: Enablement, Co-Creation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Business Today, X/@stpiindia 4. IRC's 2026 Emergency Watchlist: "New World Disorder" as Aid Collapses The International Rescue Committee released its 2026 Emergency Watchlist warning of a dangerous divergence: humanitarian needs surging while global support collapses. Key findings: more active wars than any point since WWII (1 in 7 people globally threatened by armed conflict); 83% of USAID programs cancelled since March 2025; 37 million people at emergency-level food insecurity (highest since 2021); 117.3 million forcibly displaced. A Lancet study estimates 1.8 million additional deaths in 2025 from aid cuts, potentially 14 million preventable deaths by 2030. This underscores the urgency for AI-enabled efficiency in humanitarian operations as budgets collapse. Framework tags: Response, Relief, Resilience &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: IRC Emergency Watchlist, Rescue.org 5. Yemen Health System Buckles Under USAID Cuts ‚Äî The Human Cost of Aid Collapse Today's LA Times reports hospitals in Yemen struggling to obtain basic supplies as DOGE cuts to US aid programs take effect. Nearly 20 million Yemenis require humanitarian assistance; 9.6 million women and girls face severe hunger and a collapsing health system. This is a live case study for why AI-powered supply chain optimization and predictive health analytics matter ‚Äî when budgets shrink, technology must stretch remaining resources further. Framework tags: Response, Relief &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: LA Times, UNFPA, OCHA 6. International AI Safety Report 2026: Systemic Resilience as Central Challenge Released Feb 3 ahead of the India summit, the second International AI Safety Report ‚Äî the largest global collaboration on AI safety to date ‚Äî warns of expanding AI capabilities and uneven risk management. Prepared by 100+ independent experts via Carnegie Endowment, it provides evidence-based assessment of how AI advances translate into real-world risks. Key for humanitarian practitioners: guidance on deploying AI responsibly in high-stakes environments where failures cost lives. Framework tags: Resilience, Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: Carnegie Endowment, Inside Privacy, CADE 7. Africa Multi-Hazard Early Warning Systems Expand: Mozambique Teaches Ethiopia &amp; South Sudan Published today: UNDRR reports Ethiopia and South Sudan sent delegations to learn from Mozambique's modernized National Multi-Hazard Early Warning Situation Room (inaugurated Sept 2025). The AMHEWAS network ‚Äî designed to increase availability of multi-hazard early warning systems across Africa ‚Äî is expanding. Both countries plan national situation rooms. DRC launched its own "Early Warnings for All" (EW4All) initiative on Jan 28. These multi-hazard warning systems increasingly incorporate AI-driven climate modeling and satellite data analysis for flood/drought/cyclone prediction. Framework tags: Resilience, Compounding Innovation &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ReliefWeb, UNDRR 8. University of Michigan AI Reads Brain MRIs in Seconds ‚Äî 97.5% Accuracy A new AI model from the University of Michigan can interpret brain MRIs in seconds, detecting neurological conditions with up to 97.5% accuracy and predicting urgency of care needed. This matters for humanitarian contexts where radiologists are scarce ‚Äî the model could be deployed in field hospitals and under-resourced clinics. The tool addresses a critical access gap as demand for neurological care outstrips specialist availability globally. Framework tags: Enablement &nbsp;|&nbsp; Sources: ScienceDaily, MedLink Neurology üìÖ Upcoming Events (Next 30 Days) India AI Impact Summit 2026 Dates: February 16‚Äì20, 2026 Location: Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, India Organizer: India Ministry of Electronics &amp; Information Technology Why it matters: First global AI summit in the Global South. 30+ UN side events on disaster risk reduction, health, agriculture. Free registration. Link: indiaaisummit.gov.in IndiaAI Responsibility Pledge ‚Äî Guinness World Record Attempt Dates: February 16‚Äì17, 2026 Location: Nationwide digital campaign (India) Organizer: IndiaAI + Intel India Why it matters: Attempting Guinness record for most AI responsibility pledges in 24 hours. Sets precedent for mass public engagement on responsible AI. ITU AI for Good Impact Awards ‚Äî Application Deadline Deadline: March 15, 2026 Location: Applications online; ceremony at AI for Good Summit (Geneva, July) Organizer: International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Why it matters: Global recognition for AI solutions advancing SDGs. Winners get mentoring, prizes, and UN agency networking. Open to startups and social enterprises. Link: aiforgood.itu.int AAAI Spring Symposium: AI+HADR Dates: April 7‚Äì9, 2026 Location: Hyatt Regency San Francisco Airport, Burlingame, CA Organizer: AAAI Why it matters: Dedicated symposium on AI for disasters ‚Äî drones, predictive models, satellite imagery, crisis mapping. Keynote by Humanitarian AI Award winner Milind Tambe. Link: aaai.org üåç Active Disaster Monitoring (GDACS/OCHA) Pakistan (Balochistan): M5.5 earthquake, Feb 13, 10km depth. Tremors across Sindh and Balochistan. Few people affected at high intensity. Japan: M5.5 earthquake, Feb 12, 640K in MMI IV zone. Forest fires: Active notifications in Sudan (2), Cambodia (4), Guinea (2), Senegal, Myanmar, Central African Republic. OCHA priorities today: Occupied Palestinian Territory, Ukraine, Madagascar. Aid workers in Yemen still detained ‚Äî Security Council urged to act. Sources: AP, Tribune India, Times of India, IRC, LA Times, UNFPA, ReliefWeb, UNDRR, Carnegie Endowment, ScienceDaily, GDACS, OCHA, X/Twitter, AAAI, ITU
